dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 7138 IH: Protecting Against Compromised Internet of Things Technology Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Obernolte (for himself and Ms. Jacobs of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To establish procedures to include certain foreign persons that pose a threat to the security of supply chains of Internet of Things devices on the Department of Commerce’s Entity List, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Against Compromised Internet of Things Technology Act.

section.header: Recommendations to include covered foreign persons on the Entity List

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Bureau of Industry and Security, shall submit to the End-User Review Committee—

paragraph.text: a list of covered foreign persons, if any, that the Secretary determines pose a threat to the security of supply chains of Internet of Things devices; and
a recommendation of whether or not to include each such covered foreign person on the Entity List or make other modifications to the Entity List as appropriate.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Commerce shall submit to the End-User Review Committee an updated list and corresponding recommendations under paragraph (1)—

paragraph.text: not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and every 180 days thereafter; and

section.header: Consideration and vote to include covered foreign persons on the Entity List
section.text: Not later than 90 days after receiving a list of covered foreign persons and corresponding recommendations required by section 2, the End-User Review Committee shall convene a meeting—

paragraph.text: to consider such list of covered foreign persons and corresponding recommendations; and
to hold a vote with respect to including each such covered foreign person on the Entity List or make other modifications to the Entity List as appropriate.

section.text: In the event that any company is on the list described under section 3—

paragraph.text: that company may not receive any Federal financial assistance; and
the Federal Government may not enter into any contract with such company for any Internet of Things device.

subparagraph.text: means a foreign person that produces an Internet of Things device; and
includes a parent company, subsidiary, or relevant senior officer or other official of such foreign person.

paragraph.text: The term End-User Review Committee means the End-User Review Committee described in Supplement No. 9 to part 748 of the Export Administration Regulations.

The term Entity List means the list maintained by the Bureau of Industry and Security of the Department of Commerce and set forth in Supplement No. 4 to part 744 of title 15, Code of Federal Regulations.
The term Export Administration Regulations means subchapter C of chapter VII of title 15, Code of Federal Regulations.

The term Federal financial assistance means any form of loan, grant, guarantee, insurance, payment, rebate, subsidy, or any other form of direct or indirect Federal assistance (including general or special revenue sharing or formula grants made to States) approved by any Federal officer or agency.
The term foreign person means a person that is not a United States person.
The term Internet of Things device means a device described in section 2(4) of the Internet of Things Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2020 (15 U.S.C. 278g–3a note).
The term United States person means—

subparagraph.text: a United States citizen or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence to the United States; or
an entity organized under the laws of the United States or of any jurisdiction within the United States, including a foreign branch of such an entity.
